intro: Patagonium affine, commonly known as the Patagonian thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its hairy stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are followed by orange or red berries. It thrives in dry, open habitats and is often found in grasslands and shrublands. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
